intro: Centaurea hadimensis, commonly known as the Turkish knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features striking blue to purple composite flower heads, which are composed of many small florets. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Centaurea hadimensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides.
